intent: Learn the measurement rules of the world before exploring biology (plate physics, pipeline behavior, noise floor, feature coupling, failure modes)

default_assignment.notes: Default for all wells unless overridden

notes: Interleaving breaks the confound between spatial position and cell line.
If operationally you must block by rows, keep this map for simulation anyway as the gold-standard calibration design.

cell_density_gradient.purpose: Expose density-driven confounds that masquerade as biology and stress segmentation

stain_scale_probes.purpose: Measure sensitivity to staining intensity and normalization assumptions

fixation_timing_probes.purpose: Detect timing sensitivity and whether time jitter is mistaken for mechanism

imaging_focus_probes.purpose: Stress-test robustness of feature extraction to focus drift

background_controls.purpose: Estimate staining/background and LDH baseline without cells (and detect contamination/bleed)

biological_anchors.philosophy: Anchors are for dynamic range and failure modes, not for discovering biology

anchors.role: strong morphology signature with survivable cells
stress phenotype plus LDH movement without instant plate-wide wipeout

contrastive_tiles.purpose: Local repeatability AND local sensitivity (same geometry, different semantics)

derived_fields.cell_density: from density gradient by column unless explicitly set
derived_fields.stain_scale: 1.0 unless in STAIN_LOW or STAIN_HIGH wells
derived_fields.fixation_timing_offset_min: 0 unless in EARLY_FIX or LATE_FIX wells
derived_fields.imaging_focus_offset_um: 0 unless in FOCUS_MINUS or FOCUS_PLUS wells

expected_learning_deliverables: Spatial correction model that generalizes across both cell lines (row/col/edge plus smooth 2D surface)
Noise floor per feature family under VEHICLE at LOW/NOMINAL/HIGH density
Quantified sensitivity to stain scaling (0.9x vs 1.1x) and whether normalization is distorting manifolds
Quantified sensitivity to fixation timing jitter and focus drift
LDH vs morphology coupling check: baseline independence and saturation behavior under ANCHOR_DEATH
Outlier and failure-mode catalog (segmentation failures, empty wells, illumination artifacts, edge evaporation signatures)

sanity_checks.name: cell_line_invariance_to_plate_model
sanity_checks.description: After spatial correction, the plate-effect model should not need separate parameters per cell line to remove gross drift.

sanity_checks.name: density_axis_detectable
sanity_checks.description: Vehicle morphology should show a consistent density axis; if not, either density modeling is wrong or features are over-normalized.

sanity_checks.name: stain_scale_axis_detectable
sanity_checks.description: STAIN_LOW vs STAIN_HIGH should be separable primarily in intensity-like features; if it rotates the entire manifold, normalization is broken.

sanity_checks.name: focus_probes_break_things_in_a_known_way
sanity_checks.description: FOCUS_MINUS/PLUS should degrade sharpness/texture features; if it changes everything equally, feature extraction is conflating signals.

sanity_checks.name: anchors_are_orthogonal
sanity_checks.description: ANCHOR_MORPH and ANCHOR_DEATH should not collapse onto the same direction; if they do, you are mostly measuring generic sickness.

sanity_checks.name: no_cell_background_stable
sanity_checks.description: NO_CELLS wells should cluster tightly; if not, staining/background variability is large enough to masquerade as phenotype.
